Key Match Events: Iceland secured a comeback draw against Wales in the Nations League
Logi Tomasson netted twice to draw level
Wales were clinging on and managed to keep out the hosts to earn themselves a good point
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy says Wales players have been affected by the death of George Baldock
Craig Bellamy says he is aware of the expectations on the team and promised to never 'play them down'
Wales manager Craig Bellamy says he is excited for the match
Iceland will be confident though and it's easy to see how this match plays out in a draw
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy continues his unbeaten run as Wales boss
Wales boss Craig Bellamy admits he is free to pick Rangers forward Tom Lawrence
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in cold conditions of Reykjavik
Wales started the game as the more aggressive and competent side
Iceland made substitutions and an intense press to turn the game around
Others: The predicted line-ups for both teams
The latest odds for the match
Aaron Ramsey and Ethan Ampadu missed out on the Wales squad due to injury
